chapter.title: An Introduction to Jenkins
chapter.para: Jenkins (n√©e Hudson) is a continuous integration server written in Java. It can be downloaded from http://www.jenkins-ci.org as an executable war. It means that you can run it with java -jar jenkins.war. Jenkins comes with an embedded Winstone but you also have the option to deploy the war to an application server like Tomcat or JBoss. Jenkins does not use any database to store is configuration. Everything is saved to XML files using XStream.

With Jenkins you can create, monitor and schedule Jobs. There are Plug-ins available for almost anything that you may think about, from different SCM (git, mercury, SVN, CVS) to integrating your builds with Selenium, Gerrit, TestLink and other tools.

At the moment that this guide is being written the current version of the latest and greatest Jenkins is 1.413, however it is very unlikely that what you will learn here won't work with other versions of Jenkins. The development team has been doing a great job in compatibility between versions.
